      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This being the main method, it should run the things, right? Well, actually, it's a little more, eh, simple.
      The main method actually checks the length of the args array, if it's > 0, then it passes on the args to chooseMethod(String[]), otherwise, it runs displayHelp().

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This being the main method, it should run the things, right? Well, actually, it's a little more, eh, simple.
        The main method actually checks the length of the args array, if it's > 0, then it passes on the args to chooseMethod(String[]), otherwise, it runs displayHelp().
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments passed through either the console or a shortcut.

      • displayHelp

        public static void displayHelp()
        A pretty simple function, simply runs the main method in the WrongArgsHelp class.

      • chooseMethod

        public static void chooseMethod(java.lang.String[] args)
        This function utilizes a switch/case statement on args[0] to decide which method to call. It also chops the first string out of args before passing it to the next method.
        Parameters:
        args - the args passed from main(String[])

      • packageAssets

        public static void packageAssets(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method iterates through the passed arguments and runs each one through packageAsset(String).
        Parameters:
        args - args passed from chooseMethod(String[])

      • packageAsset

        private static void packageAsset(java.lang.String path)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Figures out which operation to use, then uses that operation to run packageFile(Path, File) however many times as needed.

        This method looks at every argument given to it as a path to a file or folder. If the path ends with a /** and the path leads to a folder, it packages every file in every folder inside of the given folder. If a path ends with an /* and the path leads to a folder, then it packages all files within that folder. If the path does not end with a /* or /** and the path leads to a file, then it packages that file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file or folder
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - just as in packageFile(Path, File), simply sending the exceptions up the ladder.

      • packageFile

        public static boolean packageFile(java.nio.file.Path oldFile,
                                  java.io.File newAsset)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Takes a single file, packages it, and saves the packaged asset.
        Parameters:
        oldFile - the original file that is being packaged
        newAsset - the location of the packaged asset
        Returns:
        whether or not an error occured
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - sends any IOExceptions up the ladder for easier code reading due to less try/catchs everywhere.
